titleStmt.title: The Lord Generals letter in answer to the message of the Kentish-men, May 31. 1648. The Lord Generals proclamation against plundring, or taking any horses or goods from any of the inhabitants in Kent, and for restoring what hath been taken. Also a perfect relation of relieving Dover Castle, driving the Kentish-men to Rochester, the taking of the bidge [sic] near Norflet in Kent, the number killed and taken prisoners. With the names of the chief actors in this Kentish engagement. June 1. 1648. Imprimatur Gilbert Mabbot.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

titleStmt.title: The Lord Generals letter in answer to the message of the Kentish-men, May 31. 1648. The Lord Generals proclamation against plundring, or taking any horses or goods from any of the inhabitants in Kent, and for restoring what hath been taken. Also a perfect relation of relieving Dover Castle, driving the Kentish-men to Rochester, the taking of the bidge [sic] near Norflet in Kent, the number killed and taken prisoners. With the names of the chief actors in this Kentish engagement. June 1. 1648. Imprimatur Gilbert Mabbot.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

notesStmt.note: The Lord General = Thomas Fairfax, who signs A2r.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
